titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Independent Order of Odd Fellows Records of California Lodges
Independent Order of Odd Fellows Records of California Lodges

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 20, 2019 at 03:01

did.unittitle: Independent Order of Odd Fellows Records of California Lodges

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three groupings: July 1972 Acquisition; January 2004 Acquisition; and July 2006 Acquisition.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Independent Order of Odd Fellows Records of California Lodges is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Independent Order of Odd Fellows Records of California Lodges. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Independent Order of Odd Fellows is a fraternal organization. The Order was founded in Britain, and the American branch of the organization was founded in Baltimore, Maryland in 1819. The Order opened to women in 1851 with the founding of the Rebekah branch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Financial records and receipts, account books, membership records, meeting minutes, reports, correspondence, circulars, and ephemera generated by the activities of the Charity Lodge No. 6 of Stockton and the Hanford Lodge, the Lady of the Lake Rebekah Lodge No. 111, and the Lucerne Lodge (all located in Hanford), as well as other California-based Independent Order of Odd Fellows lodges and encampments.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing in 2014, including rehousing and minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, identified by a unique call number and titled according to month and year of acquisition.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from William P. Wreden on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 1972; purchased from Vigilante Rare Documents on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 2004; and purchased from Carmen D. Valentino on the Ramona Lazare Fund, 2006.

did.unittitle: Financial and membership records of various lodges

Reports and meeting minutes, primarily for Charity Lodge No. 6 (Stockton, Calif.)

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Vigilante Rare Documents on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 2004.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This portion of the collection is organized into four series: Hanford Lodge, Lady of the Lake Rebekah Lodge 111, Lucerne Lodge 275, and Unsorted Lodges.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains material pertaining to the Hanford Lodge of Hanford, California. Other material concerning the Hanford Lodge may be present in the "Unsorted Lodges" series.

did.unittitle: Enrollment registry, unidentified lodge or encampment
Minutes of the Executive Committee appointed by Encampment 68
Lady of the Lake Rebekah Lodge 111 (Hanford, Calif.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains material pertaining to the Lady of the Lake Rebekah Lodge 111 of Hanford, California. Other material concerning the Lady of the Lake Rebekah Lodge 111 may be present in the "Unsorted Lodges" series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains material pertaining to the Lucerne Lodge 275 of Hanford, California. Other material concerning the Lucerne Lodge 275 may be present in the "Unsorted Lodges" series.

did.unittitle: Blank book of notice of arrearage forms

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The material in this series comprises the records of numerous lodges. Material created by specific lodges has been noted at the file level.
